summary:
I am a product designer with a background in programming. For me design is not about art. It is about solving real issues not to make users think. I like to explore every small detail by researching, testing and using my previous experience and a broad range of tools and skills to create complex and high-traffic web applications like ecommerce product and geo information system.
 
Specialties: User Experience Design, User Interface Design, Interaction Design, User-Centered Design, User Research, Designing for Data, User Flows, Site Maps, Design/Team Management, Data Visualization, Cross-Platform Design, Visual Design.

profile_positions.description:
Alibaba Group is a Chinese multinational technology company specializing in e-commerce, retail, Internet, and technology. The company hosts the largest B2B (Alibaba.com), C2C (Taobao), and B2C (Tmall and AliExpress) marketplaces in the world. AliExpress.ru is the most visited e-commerce website in Russia. It facilitates small businesses to sell to customers all over the world.

Being a part of Alibaba Group I have been working on B2B services in AliExpress and Tmall. During this year I have successfully taken part in several projects:
1) New registration service
There was a universal registration service for all sellers. My team had to adapt and localize this service for the Russian market. I conducted competitive analysis and guerrilla UX tests with sellers. I found weak spots, rewrote user scenarios, and changed the user flow.
Results: the conversion rate increased from 85% to 92% in the first month.

2) Reconstruction of the product posting interface
We had a lack of products from Russian sellers. Previously it took a long time for them to post products through the interface because of some UX troubles. The business task was to increase the range of products. I initiated a full-fledged UX research: collected all users feedback, conducted 8 in-depth interviews, and 5 UX tests. Finally, I redesigned the whole interface for the product posting flow.
Results: More than 100 000 products were posted via the new interface for 3 months. Additionally, the support service received no requests.

3) Homepage redesign
Our support team shared several insights on the homepage. Based on these insights I conducted surveys and found out that Russian sellers expect different data and tools on the homepage. Currently, I am looking for a design solution for this task.

profile_positions.description:
Yandex is a multinational corporation specialising in Internet-related services and products. It is the largest technology company in Russia and the largest search engine on the Russian-language Internet, with a market share of over 52%. Yandex.Market is currently one of the most popular marketplaces in Russia. It enables customers to compare prices and product features, check the feedback about the store and then make a purchase.

While working for Yandex.Market I was creating a b2b product currently used by 27 000 active users monthly. Experienced team, streamlined work processes, UX laboratory and various research tools (preference testing, task-oriented, A/B testing and in-depth and contextual interviews) helped me reach great results: usability satisfaction ratings for the user interface in the last quarter of 2018 increased by 11%. In addition to my main responsibilities I took part in building a b2b design system - formulating guidelines, creating UI components.

Apart from that, I worked on the design project with the help of which sellers can calculate the potential profit from placing their products on Yandex.Market. This landing page was able to brought more than 1000 new clients for the 1st quarter of 2019. Compared to the previous quarter, I increased the number of new sellers by 9%. 
Case study is here: https://egorpermyakov.myportfolio.com/yandexmarket

In 2018 I took part in educational programs for developers at Yandex performing as Design Mentor. Together with participants we were developing new concepts for improved functionality of Yandex.Market. As a result, we created a new interface for sellers which helps them place their products on Yandex.Market.

profile_positions.description:
Otkritie Bank is one of Russia's largest full-service commercial banks. I was creating an interface for web service which provides tools for stock trading, analytics and receiving financial statements. 

During the course of my work I conducted interviews with stakeholders, developed user scenarios and prototypes for usability testing. While working over the project I completely redesigned this bank system reducing time which was required to process one financial transfer.
profile_positions.title: UX/UI Designer

profile_positions.description:
Urbica is a design and consultancy agency based in Moscow. It focuses on human experience design. Urbica deals with information design, user interfaces, service design, architecture, environmental planning, data analysis and ethnographic research.

The project I worked on was Business Navigator. It is the geographic information system for entrepreneurs that helps to find the best place where you can locate your business and automatically calculate a rough business plan. During the course of my work I conducted interviews with potential entrepreneurs, developed user scenarios and a prototype for usability testing. As a frontend developer I made this interface using the Semantic UI framework. This project won the Tagline Award.

Also I took part in the development workshop where I learned to analyze, manipulate and visualize geo-data. As a result, I created the interactive map which showed ski resorts in Russia, using QGIS and Mapbox.js. 

Tools and technologies: Sketch App, InVision, Mapbox.js, ReactJS, Semantic UI.

profile_positions.description:
iSimpleLab is a big IT company engaged in producing online banking software. Its headquarters is located in Moscow. There are more than 50 Russian banks among the company's clients.

I led a team of three web designers: interviewed new frontend developers, delegated tasks and did code reviews. My responsibilities included conducting competitive analyses, creating wireframes and design concepts for mobile and web applications. As a front end developer I crafted markups. I took part in discussions about mockups and held demonstrations of system features for customers.

Among my achievements in this company I would like to note the following:
- In the first year of my work I did the research, designed mockups and produced a new web interface for the mobile website utilizing HTML, CSS, Groovy. 
- Later in the course of my work I totally modified the interface of the online banking iSimpleBank 2.0 which included revamping the layout of main and payment pages, elaborating the responsive design, drawing the flat icon set and UI elements. Also I refreshed the design for native apps for iOS and Android following their guidelines. 

Tools and technologies: Sketch App, Balsamiq, Photoshop, HTML5, CSS3, Groovy, ZUL

volunteer_experiences.description:
I had the opportunity to participate in a three-month volunteer project at a local dermatological center in Tver. My aim was to create an A1 poster which gives advice to adults from children with HIV. It was my first time working with the medical industry (social work) and on a printing project.

My client was physician which works with children who have HIV and had a few ideas and goals. I came up with the concept to incorporate her ideas for messaging. I created printed copies to determine colors. Then I visited the center several times to discuss my mockups with specialists and choose the most appropriate version. As a result, I received an award from the chief physician.
